3f9de9ca-2ac8-472c-b969-a2dbd071ef43 Finishing Up When you think they are done, grab one and pop it into your mouth. Give it your nod of approval and get them into the house for everyone else to try.
3f9de9ca-2ac8-472c-b969-a2dbd071ef43 Finishing Up If they need a little longer, let them go another 4-5 minutes then try another one.
3f9de9ca-2ac8-472c-b969-a2dbd071ef43 Finishing Up Serve immediately!
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Make the Meatloaf Place 2 lbs of ground beef (80/20), 2 eggs, ¾ cup of diced green bell pepper, 1 cup of onion, ½ cup of quick oats, ¼ cup worcestershire, 2 eggs, 1/3 cup of Jeff's rub, and 1/3 cup of Jeff's sauce into a large mixing bowl
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Make the Meatloaf Combine the ingredients together well.
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Create the Bacon Weave This is something that is almost impossible to write out in a way that can be understood without images. You are looking for a weave that is 3 strips of bacon wide. Use half strips weaved into those 3 steps to create the "weave".
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Create the Bacon Weave Create the weave on one end of a piece of wax or parchment paper.
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Form the Meatloaf into Logs With the meatloaf that has been mixed together, form (2) logs that are as long as your bacon weave and about 2 inches in diameter
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Form the Meatloaf into Logs Form the logs on the other end of the wax paper.
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Wrap the Bacon Weave Around the Meatloaf Log Use the wax paper to help you roll/place the log onto the edge of the bacon weave.
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Wrap the Bacon Weave Around the Meatloaf Log Continue to roll the meatloaf log until the bacon weave is wrapped around it.
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Season the Wrapped Meatloaf Logs Sprinkle Jeff's rub generously onto the outside of the wrapped meatloaf logs
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Smoke the Meatloaf Logs Set up your smoker for cooking at about 225°F
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Smoke the Meatloaf Logs Place the wrapped meatloaf logs directly onto the smoker grate or use a bradley rack.
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Smoke the Meatloaf Logs Smoke cook for about 2.5 hours or until the internal temperature of the meat reads 165°F
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Finishing Up Remove the smoked meatloaf logs from the smoker once they are finished.
7f4f2205-085a-45f7-83e4-36df27e2ed7f Finishing Up Slice and serve immediately.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Make the Lollipops Rinse chicken legs under cold water
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Make the Lollipops Lay one of the chicken legs on the cutting board or hard surface.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Make the Lollipops Make a cut through skin, meat and tendons all the way around the chicken leg, just below the knuckle
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Make the Lollipops Push meat all to one end leaving at least half of the bone on the knuckle end as a handle.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Make the Lollipops Snip off any extruding tendons, meat, fat, etc. to clean it up.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Make the Lollipops Repeat process on all chicken legs.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Season & Marinate the Chicken Legs Apply mayonnaise to outside of chicken to create a stick surface for the seasoning to stick to.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Season & Marinate the Chicken Legs Sprinkle Jeff's rub onto each chicken leg making sure to coat all sides thoroughly.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Season & Marinate the Chicken Legs Place all of the seasoned chicken into a lidded bowl or ziptop bag and place it in the fridge for 2 hours minimum. You can also marinate overnight if desired.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Season & Marinate the Chicken Legs After marinating time is complete, remove chicken from fridge.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Wrap Handles with Foil To prevent the handles from getting too dark or burnt, cut a square 4-inch pieces of foil for each chicken leg.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Wrap Handles with Foil Wrap the foil around the handle (bone) of each chicken leg.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Smoking the Chicken Preheat smoker to 250°F
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Smoking the Chicken Place chicken directly on smoker grate
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Smoking the Chicken Let chicken cook for about 2 hours or until it reaches 175°F in the thickest part.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Smoking the Chicken If you want to add sauce to the chicken (highly recommended) do so during the last 30 minutes of the cooking time.
eae4ae39-bebe-4b61-abbd-09074a931c74 Finishing Up Remove foil from chicken and serve immediately.
a12ead09-c098-4599-aa2d-dafee6ff20fd Prepare Meat for Smoking Drizzle honey on country style ribs or pork steaks and spread onto meat using hands or a basting brush.
a12ead09-c098-4599-aa2d-dafee6ff20fd Prepare Meat for Smoking Sprinkle Jeff's rub onto all sides of the meat
a12ead09-c098-4599-aa2d-dafee6ff20fd Smoke Cook Country Style Ribs and Pork Steaks Set up smoker for cooking at about 225°F
a12ead09-c098-4599-aa2d-dafee6ff20fd Smoke Cook Country Style Ribs and Pork Steaks Place meat directly on smoker grate
a12ead09-c098-4599-aa2d-dafee6ff20fd Smoke Cook Country Style Ribs and Pork Steaks Let the meat cook until it reaches 175-180°F
a12ead09-c098-4599-aa2d-dafee6ff20fd Smoke Cook Country Style Ribs and Pork Steaks About an hour before the meat is finished, brush some of Jeff's sauce onto the meat.
a12ead09-c098-4599-aa2d-dafee6ff20fd Smoke Cook Country Style Ribs and Pork Steaks When the meat is finished cooking, serve immediately.
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Prepare Shrimp Remove shells from shrimp
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Prepare Shrimp Put the shrimp down into a ziptop bag with about ¼ cup of Jeff's rub and shake/roll to coat.
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Prepare Shrimp Place bag of shrimp in the fridge for 30-60 minutes to marinate
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Prepare Jalapeño Peppers Cut peppers in half lengthwise
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Prepare Jalapeño Peppers Remove seeds and veins completely
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Prepare Cream Cheese Mixture Mix 8 ounces of cream cheese with 1 cup of shredded cheddar and 3 TBS of Jeff's rub
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Prepare Cream Cheese Mixture Mix well to combine ingredients
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Stuffing the Peppers Lay marinated shrimp into pepper half
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Stuffing the Peppers Make partial cuts into the body of the shrimp to help it lay flat
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Stuffing the Peppers Stuff cream cheese mixture over the top and sides of the shrimp to fill pepper half
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Stuffing the Peppers Wrap half strips of bacon around stuffed pepper halves
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Smoking the Stuffed Jalapeño Peppers Set up smoker for cooking at about 225°F
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Smoking the Stuffed Jalapeño Peppers Place stuffed peppers directly on smoker grate
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Smoking the Stuffed Jalapeño Peppers Smoke with pecan wood (or other smoking wood) for about 3 hours or until peppers are soft
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Smoking the Stuffed Jalapeño Peppers For crispy bacon, place peppers under oven broiler for a few minutes watching them closely
3225a495-a55f-4432-a2a0-801fa44dce56 Smoking the Stuffed Jalapeño Peppers Serve immediately!
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Prepare Baby Back Ribs for Smoking Remove membrane from bone side of ribs using a paper towel to get a good grip
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Prepare Baby Back Ribs for Smoking Apply a thin coat of yellow mustard to the bone side
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Prepare Baby Back Ribs for Smoking Sprinkle enough of Jeff's rub onto he ribs to cover the meat
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Prepare Baby Back Ribs for Smoking Once the rub gets that typical "wet" look, flip them over and repeat the mustard and rub on the meaty side
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Smoking the Ribs Set up your smoker for smoking at about 225°F
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Smoking the Ribs Place the ribs directly on the smoker grate or you can use a rib rack if you need to fit more
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Smoking the Ribs Let the ribs smoke cook until they are as tender as you like them. (this is normally about 5 hours for baby back ribs)
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Smoking the Ribs Sauce the ribs about 30 minutes before they are finished for best results.
2c3bc7c8-0360-408e-bf08-f4b38fd061e2 Smoking the Ribs When the ribs are finished cooking, remove them from the smoker, slice 'em up and serve.
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Prepare the Chuck Roast Rinse the piece of meat under cold water
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Prepare the Chuck Roast Apply a thin coat of yellow mustard to the chuck roast
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Prepare the Chuck Roast Sprinkle on a coat of Jeff's rub onto all sides of the meat
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Smoking the Chuck Roast Prepare smoker for cooking at about 235°F
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Smoking the Chuck Roast Place meat directly onto smoker grate
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Smoking the Chuck Roast Cook for 12-20 hours or until the thickest part of the meat measures 195°F
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Smoking the Chuck Roast Apply smoke for at least 6 hours if you are using an electric, gas or charcoal smoker.
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Smoking the Chuck Roast The meat can be wrapped in foil once it reaches 160 °F to hold in moisture and to speed up the process
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Resting Once the meat reaches 195 °F, wrap the meat in foil (if you haven't already) then in a thick towel and place it an empty ice cooler to rest for at least 1 hour.
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Resting Fill in any remaining space in the cooler with more towels or blankets.
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Chopping or Pulling the Meat Once the meat has rested, open the foil and allow it to cool for a few minutes then using heat resistant gloves, pull the meat into pieces.
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Chopping or Pulling the Meat Remove any fat and/or gelatinous substance you come across
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Chopping or Pulling the Meat Further pull or chop the meat into the size that you want.
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Chopping or Pulling the Meat Apply more rub and stir into the meat
f9c020e1-6157-42d0-b97c-b578ee881d88 Chopping or Pulling the Meat The meat is now ready to serve
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Cut Chickens in Half Remove backbone by cutting along both sides of the backbone with kitchen shears
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Cut Chickens in Half Remove keel bone
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Cut Chickens in Half Cut through center of chicken to divide into two halves
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Cut Chickens in Half Watch video at http://youtu.be/PYVaWI3LaG0 for full instructions
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Brine Chicken Halves Place chickens into plastic or glass bowl with a lid
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Brine Chicken Halves Mix 1 cup of koshers salt, 1 gallon of water and ¾ cup of brown sugar and stir until well dissolved.
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Brine Chicken Halves Pour brine mixture over chicken until covered and refrigerate for 3 hours
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Brine Chicken Halves After 3 hours, rinse chicken well under cold water
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Smoking the Chicken Set up smoker for cooking at about 225°F.
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Smoking the Chicken Place chicken directly on smoker grate
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Smoking the Chicken Smoke chicken for 3 hours or until a meat thermometer inserted in the leg or thigh measures 165°F
59f105fe-ac51-47a5-beac-cf2b4ed6f8c1 Smoking the Chicken Serve immediately
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Prepare Salmon Cut salmon in half lengthwise separating the thick part from the thinner part.
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Prepare Salmon Further separate lengthwise into strips that are 1.5 to 2 inches wide
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Prepare Salmon Make cuts every 2 inches or so vertically through the fish stopping when you reach the skin
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Prepare Salmon Slide the knife blade between the fish and the skin to separate the skin from the fish
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Prepare Salmon Place the pieces of salmon onto skewers making sure to put pieces of similar thickness on the same skewer
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Prepare Salmon Brush olive oil onto the salmon to help the rub to stick
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Prepare Salmon Sprinkle Jeff's rub onto the salmon to add a nice layer of flavor and seasoning to the fish.
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Smoking the Salmon Place the salmon skewers onto oiled smoker grates
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Smoking the Salmon Smoke fish at 225°F for about 1 to 1.5 hours or until it reaches 135°F* in the center.
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Smoking the Salmon Use a thermometer to check the temperature of the fish after about 45 minutes or sooner if the fish is a little on the thin side.
c891ef25-3539-47cb-9411-af83fddfc466 Serving the Smoked Salmon When the fish has reached 135°F*, remove it from the smoker and serve immediately.
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Marinate the Scallops Place scallops in ziptop bag with olive oil and 1 TBS of Jeff's original rub
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Marinate the Scallops Seal bag then roll and massage bag gently to fully coat scallops
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Marinate the Scallops Place bag in fridge for 1 hour to marinate
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Wrap Scallops in Bacon Place scallop onto one end of a thin slice of bacon
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Wrap Scallops in Bacon Wrap bacon around scallop allowing an overlap of about ½ inch
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Wrap Scallops in Bacon Cut bacon to fit perfectly
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Wrap Scallops in Bacon Push toothpick through bacon overlap and all the way through scallop to secure
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Wrap Scallops in Bacon Repeat on all scallops
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Wrap Scallops in Bacon Place bacon wrapped and secured scallops onto bradley rack or cookie sheet
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Wrap Scallops in Bacon Sprinkle Jeff's Texas style rub onto the outside of the wrapped scallops.
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Smoke Scallops Place scallops directly onto smoker grate and cook for about 1 hour
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Smoke Scallops Scallops are done when they reach 145°F in the center
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Smoke Scallops Apply smoke for at least 20 minutes or up to 1 hour if desired
d03f5ab1-3667-4b37-abbd-a28fa2cd10cb Smoke Scallops Serve immediately
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare Ribs For Smoking Rinse ribs under cool water
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare Ribs For Smoking Remove any large areas of fat on meaty side of ribs
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare Ribs For Smoking Flip the ribs over and remove the membrane from the bone side
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare Ribs For Smoking Wet the ribs with apple cider vinegar
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare Ribs For Smoking Apply a generous coat of Jeff's rub to the bone side
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare Ribs For Smoking Turn the ribs over and apply the vinegar and rub to the meaty side
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare Ribs For Smoking Cut the rack of ribs in half
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare the Onion/Garlic Base Slice two onions into ¼ inch slices and separate the rings
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare the Onion/Garlic Base Place the rings and 8-10 garlic cloves in a large foil pan
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare the Onion/Garlic Base Pour enough cola to fill the pan to about ½ full
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare the Onion/Garlic Base Lay one of the rib halves on top of the onions and garlic
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Prepare the Onion/Garlic Base Prepare a 2nd pan in the same manner for the other half of the ribs
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Smoking the Ribs Set up smoker to cook at about 250°F
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Smoking the Ribs Place the pan(s) of ribs onto the smoker grates
a8299a14-5d6e-42de-a41c-f2255dfe73d5 Smoking the Ribs Cook for 5-6 hours or until they ribs are as tender as you like them
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Remove chicken from package and give them a good rinse
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Pat them dry and lay them on a flat surface such as a cutting board or plate
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Apply a light coat of Jeff's rub on the top side
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Flip them over and lay (2) stalks of asparagus on the chicken
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Fold the chicken over the top of the asparagus
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Hold chicken in place while you wrap a long piece of thin sliced bacon around it
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Insert a toothpick through the bacon and chicken to keep everything in place
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Sprinkle more of my rub onto the outside of the bacon wrapped chicken breast
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Prepare Chicken Breasts for Smoking Place prepared chicken breasts into a lidded container and into the fridge overnight or at least 4 hours
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Smoking the Asparagus Stuffed Chicken Breasts Set up smoker with indirect heat
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Smoking the Asparagus Stuffed Chicken Breasts Preheat to 225°F
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Smoking the Asparagus Stuffed Chicken Breasts When smoker is holding a steady temperature place chicken breasts directly on the grate
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Smoking the Asparagus Stuffed Chicken Breasts Smoke for about 1.5 hours or until they reach 165°F in the thickest part
47ddb5a9-86f9-4688-b21b-89321684798e Smoking the Asparagus Stuffed Chicken Breasts Apply hickory/apple or your favorite wood smoke for at least 1 hour
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Make the Herb Rub Add the following ingredients to a food processor and mix until well combined: About a cup of fresh thyme sprigs, 1-½ sprigs of fresh rosemary, 4 cloves of garlic, 2 heaping tablespoons of Jeff's original rub, ½ cup of olive oil.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Prepare the Meat Trim off all exterior fat.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Prepare the Meat Make diagonal cuts into the meat about ¼ inch deep and about 1 inch apart all over the meat.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Prepare the Meat Add a good sprinkling of Jeff's rub all over the meat and work it in good.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Prepare the Meat Add half of the herb rub to the top of the pork loin and work it into the top and sides of the meat.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Prepare the Meat Flip the meat over and apply the other half of the herb rub.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Prepare the Meat Place the loin in a lidded container and place in the fridge overnight.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Prepare the Meat About 30 minutes before ready to smoke, remove meat from fridge and tie it up using kitchen twine to make it nice and round instead of oblong.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Smoke the Pork Loin Preheat smoker to 225°F.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Smoke the Pork Loin Place the pork loin directly on the grate and let it cook for 3-4 hours or until it reaches 145°F n the center of the roast.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Smoke the Pork Loin Remove from the smoker and carve into ½ inch slices.
82aa3489-46df-4fb3-87c4-b3cb38d858d1 Smoke the Pork Loin Serve immediately.
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Prepare the Burgers for Smoking Make patties that are about ½ inch thick and 4 to 5 inches in diameter.
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Prepare the Burgers for Smoking Lay the patties flat on a plate or flat surface
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Prepare the Burgers for Smoking Pour on a little Worcestershire sauce to wet the surface of the meat
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Prepare the Burgers for Smoking Sprinkle rub on the top of the burger patties.
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Prepare the Burgers for Smoking Wait about 10 minutes for the "wet" look then flip them over and repeat.
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Burgers Preheat smoker to 225°F
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Burgers Place burgers directly on grate over indirect heat
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Burgers Smoke cook for 60-90 minutes applying hickory or other wood smoke the entire time.
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Burgers The burgers are finished when they reach 160 °F in the center or your desired level of doneness.
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Prepare Hotdogs for Smoking Remove hotdogs from package
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Prepare Hotdogs for Smoking Roll hotdogs in Jeff's rub making sure to not miss the ends
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Hotdogs Prepare smoker for cooking at 225°F
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Hotdogs Once smoker is ready, place hotdogs directly on smoker grate
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Hotdogs Apply hickory or other wood smoke the entire time
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Hotdogs Let the hotdogs cook for about an hour or until they are heated through
59a04ee8-06dd-49ce-afa1-64eec8a862c7 Smoking the Hotdogs Remove from smoker and serve immediately
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Mustard and Seasoning Apply a coat of regular yellow mustard to all sides of the meat
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Mustard and Seasoning Sprinkle a generous amount of Jeff's original rub onto all sides of the meat
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Mustard and Seasoning Wait for about 20-30 minutes until the meat starts to get a "wet" look
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Smoking the Meat - Step 1 Place meat directly on grate or use a rack
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Smoking the Meat - Step 1 Smoke for 4-5 hours at 225-240°F or until the meat reaches 170°F in the center
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Smoking the Meat - Step 1 Bring the meat into the house and let it cool for about 30 minutes
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Smoking the Meat - Step 1 Once cool, cut the meat into 1-inch by 1-inch cubes
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Spicy Butter Injection Mix 1 stick of melted butter with 1 TBS of your favorite hot sauce (I used Tabasco with Habanero)
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Spicy Butter Injection Use an injector to inject each piece with butter until the butter runs out of the meat
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Spicy Butter Injection Place injected pieces into an open foil pan
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Spicy Butter Injection Sprinkle on more rub to create a nice bark all over
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Smoking the Meat - Step 2 Place the pan of injected pieces back into the smoker
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Smoking the Meat - Step 2 Continue to smoke cook for about 2 hours or until they get tender to your liking.
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Smoking the Meat - Step 2 Stir occasionally while they cook
5e74e468-199f-48a2-a17c-90cac209a783 Finishing up Serve immediately on toothpicks as an appetizer, piled onto a bun or as an entree with several vegetables or sides.
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Getting the Ribs Ready If you purchased a slab, remove the membrane from the boney side of the ribs
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Getting the Ribs Ready Cut them up into individual ribs
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Dry Brining Place the ribs into a bowl or container
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Dry Brining Brush olive oil onto the meat and sprinkle rub onto the top and sides of the ribs
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Dry Brining Cover the container and place the ribs in the fridge for 2 hours to dry brine
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Dry Brining After 2 hours, remove the ribs from the fridge and allow them to sit on the counter for about 30 minutes (do not rinse off the rub)
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Smoke the Ribs Place the ribs bone side down directly on the smoker grate
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Smoke the Ribs Smoke at 225 °F for 4-5 hours or until they get as tender as you like them
4fe3b1b1-61c3-4e3e-8f5c-242ab07e099b Finish Serve immediately with a couple of sides such as savory potatoes and sautéed green beans
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Buttermilk Soak Remove any extra, loose fat from meat
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Buttermilk Soak Place meat in bowl and cover with buttermilk
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Buttermilk Soak Cover and place in fridge for 4 hours
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Buttermilk Soak Remove from fridge and drain buttermilk.
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Buttermilk Soak Discard buttermilk
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Dry Brine Place single layer of meat into container
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Dry Brine Sprinkle a generous coat of rub onto meat
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Dry Brine Place another layer on top of the first
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Dry Brine Sprinkle a generous coat of rub onto 2nd layer of meat
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Dry Brine Repeat layers until all meat is coated with rub
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Dry Brine Cover and place in fridge for 2 hours
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Dry Brine Remove from fridge
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Bacon Wrap Stretch a piece of bacon until it is about 2x it's normal length
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Bacon Wrap Wrap stretched piece of bacon around thigh
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Bacon Wrap Lay on cookie sheet or Bradley rack
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Smoking the Chicken Thighs Preheat smoker to 240°F
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Smoking the Chicken Thighs Smoke cook with cherry wood for about 2 hours or until center of meat reads 165°F using a digital meat thermometer or Thermapen
6a74ffba-4d25-40d5-84ca-08f2db76b64f Smoking the Chicken Thighs Serve immediately
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Make up a batch of my rub using my very own personal recipe (purchase recipe)
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Apply the rub liberally all over a pork butt (be very generous with it)
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Preheat smoker to 225-240°F
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Place the meat fat side down directly on the smoker grate
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Smoke cook for about 6 hours or until it reaches 160°F in the center
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Wrap meat in foil (or place in foil pan covered tightly in foil) and continue to cook until the internal temperature reaches 205°F
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Remove foiled meat from smoker (carefully) and place on counter to rest for about an hour. (open foil slightly to allow some heat to escape)
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Remove bone then pull meat into it’s natural sections
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Spend a few minutes picking out any clumps of fat, gelatin-like substance, membrane, etc.
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Steps to Making Perfect Pulled Pork Pull the meat into small chunks and pieces using your hands or a couple of forks
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Pulled Pork Filling Ingredients (4)oz cream cheese
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Pulled Pork Filling Ingredients ½ cup pulled pork (make sure it has cooled well)
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Pulled Pork Filling Ingredients (1)TBS Jeff’s Rub
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Pulled Pork Filling Ingredients ½ TBS Lemon Juice
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Pulled Pork Filling Ingredients (1/8) cup (2 TBS) finely chopped onions
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Pulled Pork Filling Ingredients (1/8) cup (2 TBS) finely chopped red jalapeños (green will work if you can’t find the red ones)
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Pulled Pork Filling Instructions Add all ingredients to a medium sized mixing bowl and fold together until combined.
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Ingredients (4) oz cream cheese
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Ingredients (4) oz (¼ of a chub) ground breakfast sausage (like Jimmy Dean’s), Hot
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Ingredients (1)TBS Jeff’s Rub
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Ingredients ½ cup finely chopped onions
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Ingredients ¼ cup finely chopped green jalapeños
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Ingredients ½ TBS lemon juice
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Ingredients ¼ cup of hand grated parmesan cheese
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Instructions Cook the sausage in a frying pan over medium heat until well browned then remove to cool.
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Instructions Put onions and jalapeños into the same frying pan without adjusting the heat and cook for about 2-3 minutes stirring frequently.
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Sausage & Cheese Filling Instructions Once the sausage, onions and jalapeños are cooled, add all ingredients to a medium sized mixing bowl and fold together until combined.
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Preparing and Stuffing the Mushrooms Remove stems from mushrooms
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Preparing and Stuffing the Mushrooms Wash mushrooms under cold water
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Preparing and Stuffing the Mushrooms Use a teaspoon to fill each mushroom with desired filling
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Preparing and Stuffing the Mushrooms Sprinkle some extra rub on the mushrooms for good measure
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Smoking the Mushrooms Preheat smoker to 225°F
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Smoking the Mushrooms Place the mushrooms directly on the smoker grate
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Smoking the Mushrooms Smoke for 45-60 minutes or until they are warm in the center and slightly browned on top
7f41ac57-54f0-4df3-a5a7-b28e2852dc80 Smoking the Mushrooms Serve immediately
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Make the Beer Brine Put all ingredients except ice in a large pot and bring to a boil stirring occasionally.
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Make the Beer Brine Cover and let sit for about 10 minutes
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Make the Beer Brine Add ice cubes and stir to cool down. Finish cooling in fridge if necessary.
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Brining the Cornish Hens Place the chickens in a zip top bag or other brining container
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Brining the Cornish Hens Pour cold brine over birds to cover.
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Brining the Cornish Hens Place brining container/bag in the fridge for 4 hours
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Brining the Cornish Hens After 4 hours, rinse cornish hens under cold water
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Seasoning the Outside Apply some spicy brown mustard to the outside of the hens
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Seasoning the Outside Sprinkle Jeff's rub generously onto hens
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Smoking the Birds Place meat breast side up directly on smoker grate
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Smoking the Birds Smoke cook at 250°F for about 2 hrs or until they reach 165°F in the thickest part of the breast or thigh
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Smoking the Birds Brush on beer barbecue sauce (recipe below) about 30 minutes before chickens are done cooking. (reserve some for dipping later)
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Finishing Up Serve immediately giving each person their own cornish hen.
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Beer Barbecue Sauce Instructions Add all of the beer barbecue sauce ingredients into a small saucepan.
b9d94bc9-30dc-420f-8a45-13c33456e3e7 Beer Barbecue Sauce Instructions Stir to combine and simmer over very low heat until ready to use.
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Prep and Season Remove from packaging and rinse well under cold water
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Prep and Season Pat dry with paper towel
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Prep and Season Brush some maple syrup to add flavor and help the rub to stick
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Prep and Season Apply Jeff's rub all over the pork tenderloins
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Smoking the Tenderloins Get the smoker going and let it level out at 225°F
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Smoking the Tenderloins Place the meat directly on the smoker grate
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Smoking the Tenderloins Use peach wood or other fruity wood to apply smoke for entire session
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Smoking the Tenderloins Meat is done when a trusted meat thermometer reads 145°F in the thickest part
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Serving Allow the meat to rest on the counter under foil for 25-30 minutes
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Serving Slice into ¼ inch medallions and serve immediately.
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Barbecue Peach Chutney Recipe
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Ingredients ½ cup peach jam
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Ingredients ½ cup Jeff's barbecue sauce
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Instructions Put jam into a sauce pan over medium heat
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Instructions Once the jam starts to melt, add the barbecue sauce to the pan
81925584-6356-41ab-80fc-db5588049e6c Instructions Stir until it is well mixed and heated through
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Brining Rinse the brisket flat with cold water
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Brining Pat the brisket dry with a paper towel and set aside
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Brining Mix 1 quart of water, 2 TBS of Tabasco habanero sauce and ¼ cup of kosher salt
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Brining Stir until salt is dissolved
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Brining Place brisket is a gallon sized zip top bag or suitable brining container
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Brining Pour orange juice brine over brisket until it is covered
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Brining Seal bag and place in fridge overnight
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Seasoning Using cold water, rinse brisket with cold water to remove extra salt
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Seasoning Pat brisket dry with a paper towel
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Seasoning Apply a thin coat of yellow mustard to the outside of the brisket
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Seasoning Generously apply Jeff's rub to all sides of the brisket
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Smoking Place brisket directly on smoker grate fat side down
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Smoking Smoke at 240°F for 8-10 hours or until very tender
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Smoking Wrap in foil when meat temperature reaches 160°F
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Serving Leave brisket in foil once it finishes and let it rest on counter for about 1 hour
d489d12c-a356-4a0d-a0d2-4737f62344bc Serving Slice across the grain and serve immediately
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Prepare the Fillings
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Reuben Filling TBS pastrami, chopped or torn into small pieces
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Reuben Filling TBS Sauer kraut
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Reuben Filling TBS Swiss cheese, grated
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Reuben Filling TBS 1000 Island dressing (use more if desired)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Ham and Cheddar heaping TBS of ham, diced
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Ham and Cheddar cheddar cheese cubes (I buy the ones already cubed. You could also use grated)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Ham and Cheddar TBS of Jeff’s barbecue sauce (purchase recipe here)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Hawaiian Pulled Pork TBS of pulled pork, shredded into small pieces
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Hawaiian Pulled Pork TBS of pineapple, crushed
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Hawaiian Pulled Pork TBS of Jeff’s barbecue sauce (purchase recipe here)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Buffalo Chicken heaping TBS of diced or shredded chicken
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Buffalo Chicken TBS of Jeff’s barbecue sauce (purchase recipe here)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Buffalo Chicken TBS of Frank’s Original Red Hot sauce
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Buffalo Chicken cheddar cheese cube (optional)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Asian Pulled Pork TBS of pulled pork, shredded into small pieces
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Asian Pulled Pork TBS of Sriracha sauce
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Asian Pulled Pork TBS of Hellman’s REAL mayonnaise
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Asian Pulled Pork TBS of Jeff’s barbecue sauce (purchase recipe here)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Pizza TBS of pepperoni, diced
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Pizza TBS of mushrooms, diced
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Pizza TBS of red onions, chopped
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Pizza TBS of mozzarella cheese, shredded
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Pizza TBS of Jeff’s barbecue sauce (purchase recipe here)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Surf n’ Turf TBS of raw* sirloin (or other tender steak), chopped into small pieces
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Surf n’ Turf TBS of very small shrimp or shrimp cut into small pieces
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Surf n’ Turf TBS of green peppers/onions cooked until al dente in a frying pan with a little olive oil
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Surf n’ Turf ½ TBS of Worcestershire sauce
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Surf n’ Turf *I figure the steak will reach at least medium during the cooking process. If you are worried about it, you can always cook/grill it first.
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d ABT TBS of cream cheese, softened
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d ABT TBS of mixed cheese, grated (Mexican blend, 4 cheese blend, etc.)
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d ABT TBS of jalapeño, cleaned, deseeded and chopped
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d ABT TBS of lil’ smokies, chopped into small pieces
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d ABT Once your selected fillings are made and ready, set them aside.
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Prepare and Fill the Sausage Divide 1 pound of sausage into 10 equal sized balls
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Prepare and Fill the Sausage Flatten a ball of sausage onto your hand forming a boat
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Prepare and Fill the Sausage Place about a TBS of filling into the boat
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Prepare and Fill the Sausage Fold the ends of the boat together and pinch edges to seal
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Prepare and Fill the Sausage Form into shape by rolling the sausage in your hand
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Prepare and Fill the Sausage Wrap an entire piece of bacon around the filled sausage
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Prepare and Fill the Sausage Roll the bacon wrapped sausages in a plate of rub
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Smoking the Bacon Wrapped Fatties Place directly on the grate of your smoker
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Smoking the Bacon Wrapped Fatties Smoke at 225°F to 275°F for about 1 hour or until they reach 160°F
e08e7485-3854-44ec-8516-b45aae00bf8d Smoking the Bacon Wrapped Fatties Serve immediately
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Prepare and Marinate Steaks Rinse steaks under cold water and pat dry with a paper towel
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Prepare and Marinate Steaks Sprinkle about 1/4 tsp of coarse kosher salt onto the top of each steak and place in the fridge uncovered for 2-4 hours. No need to rinse when finished.
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Prepare and Marinate Steaks Coat steaks with olive oil
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Prepare and Marinate Steaks Sprinkle Jeff's original rub generously on both sides to cover meat
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Prepare and Marinate Steaks Place steaks in glass or plastic bowl with lid
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Prepare and Marinate Steaks Marinate in fridge for 6-8 hours or overnight
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Smoke Flat Iron Steaks Place steaks directly on the grate of smoker
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Smoke Flat Iron Steaks Smoke at 225°F for about 45 minutes or until they reach 130℉ or desired doneness
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Smoke Flat Iron Steaks Let steaks rest for 15-20 minutes before serving
2324adb0-ab0d-4329-8cc2-5f6be17f74f0 Smoke Flat Iron Steaks Serve with smoked twice baked potatoes
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Lobster Cut a slit along the top of the tail from the front all the way back to where the tail fin begins.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Lobster Lay the lobsters shell side up on a rack or grill pan and they are ready for the smoker.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Shrimp If the shrimp are frozen, place them in a colander and run cold water over them for several minutes.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Shrimp Remove shells and tails and place them in a bowl for seasoning
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Shrimp Drizzle about ½ cup of olive oil over the shrimp and stir to coat. Then sprinkle on about a tablespoon of my original rub (Purchase formula here | Purchase bottled rub).
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Shrimp Stir to coat well.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Shrimp These shrimp were fairly small and I wanted to use my Bradley rack so I quickly skewered them with extra long (4-inch) toothpicks to make sure they could not fall through the holes. A Weber grill pan or even a simple cooling rack also works well.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Shrimp About 3 per toothpick.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Prepare the Shrimp The shrimp are now ready for the smoker.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Getting the Smoker Ready Set up your smoker for cooking indirect at about 225°F with pecan and/or apple wood.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Smoking the Seafood Place the lobster tails in the smoker first since it will take about 45-60 minutes. After about 30 minutes, place the shrimp in the smoker. This should get the lobster and the shrimp done at about the same time.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Smoking the Seafood While the lobsters are smoking, spread the tail open and drizzle with a mixture containing 1 stick of butter and 2 TBS of Jeff's original rub.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Smoking the Seafood 4-5 oz lobster tails will take about 45-60 minutes and will be bright red/orange and about 140°F in the center when they are finished cooking.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Smoking the Seafood Medium shrimp (41-50/lb) will take about 20-25 minutes to finish cooking and will turn from translucent to opaque when they are finished. Do not overcook.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Making the Alfredo Sauce for Fettuccine Place 3/4 cups of the shredded cheese in a large bowl; set aside the remaining cheese for later.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Making the Alfredo Sauce for Fettuccine In a saucepan, heat the butter and cream over low heat until the butter is melted (about 8 minutes). Do not boil or turn up the heat.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Making the Alfredo Sauce for Fettuccine Pour the heated cream and butter over the parmesan and stir to melt. Pour over cooked, drained pasta and toss to coat with sauce.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Making the Alfredo Sauce for Fettuccine Add the remaining parmesan and toss gently. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Putting it All Together Remove lobster meat from shell and slice each into 6-8 medallions.
0b9f38d9-9c5b-44c1-b6e5-8ff838991ddb Putting it All Together Place fettuccine onto plate with 7-8 shrimp and lobster medallions. Serve immediately!
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Prep Cherries and Habanero Chop 18 fresh cherries very fine and set aside
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Prep Cherries and Habanero Chop two cleaned/deseeded habaneros very fine and set aside (only use one habanero if you don't want them to be very hot)
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Mix it up Fold in bread crumbs, rub, blue cheese (optional), eggs, cherries and habanero to ground chicken
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Form & Season Cherry Bombs Form 1-inch cherry bombs from the chicken mixture
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Form & Season Cherry Bombs Pour some rub in a plate and roll the 1-inch balls in the rub to coat lightly
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Form & Season Cherry Bombs Insert a toothpick into the center of the cherry bombs
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Smoke the Cherry Bombs Smoke the chicken cherry bombs at 225°F for about 1 hour or until they reach 165°F in the center
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Make the Special Sauce Mix up some special sauce for the cherry bombs using one part Jeff's sauce and one part Franks Original RedHot sauce
0d0d89d4-c126-439f-b72a-e4c690c83682 Finish up and Serve Drizzle the sauce on the smoked chicken cherry bombs or serve on the side for dipping
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Slice into Pieces and Remove Skin Rinse salmon with cold water
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Slice into Pieces and Remove Skin On a cutting board, slice across the fish into 1 inch wide pieces
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Slice into Pieces and Remove Skin Remove skin using a sharp knife
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Slice into Pieces and Remove Skin Rinse fish under cold water to remove scales
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry Brine/Marinate the Salmon Place a layer of rub into a plastic or glass bowl.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry Brine/Marinate the Salmon Place the fish onto the rub.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry Brine/Marinate the Salmon Sprinkle a layer of rub onto the top of the fish pieces.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry Brine/Marinate the Salmon If you need to double-stack the fish, place another layer of rub then more fish.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry Brine/Marinate the Salmon Finish this layer with a layer of rub on top.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry Brine/Marinate the Salmon Place a lid on the container and place in the fridge for 8-12 hours or overnight.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry Brine/Marinate the Salmon Rinse the rub from the fish using cold water and lay on paper towel to drain.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry the Salmon Place the salmon on a Bradley rack or similar with at least ½ inch between pieces.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Dry the Salmon Place rack in fridge for 3-4 hours to allow the fish to dry and form a pellicle.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Smoking the Salmon Setup smoker for cooking at about 120°F
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Smoking the Salmon Place salmon pieces directly on smoker grate for 2 hours.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Smoking the Salmon Increase heat to 140°F
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Smoking the Salmon Continue to cook salmon for 2 hours
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Smoking the Salmon Increase heat to 160°F
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Smoking the Salmon Continue to cook salmon until it has reached the desired dryness/texture
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Glazing the Salmon Mix together ¾ cup of maple syrup with 2 TBS of Jeff's rub to create a glaze.
2e63869e-853d-4c33-9b93-a769e6de8aa2 Glazing the Salmon Brush the glaze on the salmon pieces every hour while they are in the smoker
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Rinse ribs under cold water
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Trim the ribs St. Louis style if desired (instructions above)
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Remove membrane and flap meat on bone side of ribs
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Apply a coat of yellow mustard then a heavy coat of rub to the bone side
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Flip the ribs over and repeat the mustard/rub application on meaty side
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Prepare smoker for cooking at 225°F with pecan + fruit wood
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Place ribs bone side down directly on smoker grate and cook for 3 hours
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Make a bed of brown sugar, rub and butter onto 36 x 18 sheet of foil
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Lay rack of ribs meat side down onto this bed of ingredients
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Wrap foil around ribs carefully then wrap with another equally sized piece
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Cook at 225°F for 2 hours
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Remove ribs from foil carefully saving the juice that has collected
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Place ribs, bone side down back onto smoker grate for 1 hour.
6b8d4b5c-f17e-4125-929a-b942bcad0cf3
Rest for 10 minutes then slice and enjoy!
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Injecting the Ham Make the rum sauce using 1/3 cup of rum, 1/3 cup of dark (or light) brown sugar, and 1/4 lb butter.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Injecting the Ham Pour the rum into a small sauce pan over low heat. Add the butter and let it melt while you stir it around. Add in the brown sugar and let it dissolve while you continue to stir. Once everything is melted and dissolved and warm, remove from the heat.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Injecting the Ham Do not let the sauce boil or you will end up making candy.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Injecting the Ham If you'd rather use a maple sauce instead of rum, use 1/3 cup of maple syrup, 2 TB of dark (or light) brown sugar and 1/4 lb of butter.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Injecting the Ham Pour the maple syrup into a small sauce pan over low heat. Add the butter and let it melt while you stir it around. Add in the brown sugar and let it dissolve while you continue to stir. Once everything is melted and dissolved and warm, remove from the heat.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Injecting the Ham Note: Do not let the sauce boil or you will end up making candy.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Injecting the Ham With the ham wrapped in plastic (to contain the mess), fill the injector with the warm sauce and inject as much as you can at 1 inch intervals. Some of it will leak out but much of it stays in there and flavors the inside of the ham.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Injecting the Ham When the injecting is finished, remove the plastic.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Seasoning the Ham Brush a little of the rum or maple sauce onto the ham to make it nice and sticky then sprinkle Jeff's original rub all over the outside of the ham.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Seasoning the Ham The ham is now ready for the smoker.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Smoking the Ham Preheat your smoker to about 225°F and when it's holding steady, place the ham directly on the grate.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Smoking the Ham Apply heat and smoke for about 3 hours or until the internal temperature of the ham reaches a good eating temperature (I prefer about 140°F).
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Serving the Ham Let the ham rest for about 15-20 minutes then slice it up into 1/4 inch thick pieces piled onto a nice platter.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Serving the Ham If you have extra sauce, consider brushing or drizzling some onto the pieces that are sliced.
eaf46829-aa0c-41d3-87d0-2785068573db Serving the Ham Disclaimer: Not all of the alcohol cooks out of the rum sauce during the brief warming period and during the time in the smoker. Rum adds a lot of nice flavor but there is still trace amounts of alcohol present when it is being served. The maple sauce is an excellent alternative.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Brining the Turkey Make a basic brine by mixing 2 gallons of cold water, 2 cups coarse kosher salt, 2 cups brown sugar (light or dark) and 1/4 cup Jeff's original rub until the salt and brown sugar are dissolved.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Brining the Turkey Put the turkey into a very large ziptop bag, a clean empty cooler or a large plastic food-safe bucket and pour the brine over the turkey to cover.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Brining the Turkey Let the turkey brine for 10-12 hours or overnight in the fridge making sure the temperature of the brine stays between 33 and 39 degrees F.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Brining the Turkey Once the turkey is finished brining, discard the brine and rinse the turkey under cold water.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Brining the Turkey While the turkey is brining, make the bacon butter by adding 5 strips of bacon (cut into 1/2 inch pieces), 1/4 cup of Jeff's original rub, 1 stick of butter and 3 garlic cloves to a food processor. Run the food processor until the mixture is smooth.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Seasoning the Turkey With your hands, work the bacon butter under the skin of the turkey as much as possible then rub it all over the outside of the turkey as well. Be generous with it.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Smoking the Turkey Set up your smoker for cooking between a range of 225 and 240 degrees F. If your smoker uses a water pan, fill it up.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Smoking the Turkey Place the turkey in the smoker breast side down and let it smoke cook with cherry wood for about 7 hours or until it reaches 165 degrees in the thickest part of the breast and thigh.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Smoking the Turkey You can brush a mixture of melted butter onto the outside of the turkey a couple of times during the last hour or so for a better finish color.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Serving the Turkey When the turkey hit 165°F remove it from the smoker and set it on the counter.
a5c2268c-6adc-49cf-b8d4-5547ac8a0bc0 Serving the Turkey Let it rest for about 20-30 minutes if possible before carving to allow the juices to redistribute throughout the turkey.
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
Remove giblets, neck, etc from cavity of chicken
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
Brine chicken if desired using 1 gallon of water, 1 cup of kosher salt and 1 cup of brown sugar mixed well until ingredients are dissolved. Pour brine over chicken to cover and into fridge for at least 4 hours (8-12 hours is better)
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
Use hands to carefully separate skin from body of chicken wherever possible and apply rub under skin.
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
Open a can of beer, root beer or Dr Pepper and dispose/drink half of it. Insert about 2 TBS of original rub into can of liquid.
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
Place cavity of chicken onto cans using the legs as props to hold it up.
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
Prepare smoker for cooking at 230-250°F with indirect heat and several chunks of hickory wood to keep the smoke flowing for at least 2 hours.
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
Place the chicken in the smoker and let it cook for about 3.5 hours or until the thickest part of the thigh and/or breast reaches 165°F.
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
While the chicken cooks, mix ¾ cup olive/vegetable oil + 2 TBS of original rub and mop this mixture onto the outside of the chicken 2 to 3 times during the last hour.
85eab83d-c8cf-42f1-8786-ddf17a52f9b8
Let the chicken rest for about 15 minutes before carving. Enjoy!
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Make the brine by mixing the coffee, brown sugar and kosher salt together. Stir until the ingredients are dissolved. Add the rub and stir to combine.
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Place the brine solution in the fridge, preferably overnight, to get cold.
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Prep the ribs for brining by removing the membrane on the boney side of the ribs
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Place the ribs in a plastic container or a large zip top bag then pour the brine solution over the top of the ribs to cover. Refrigerate for 6 hours then rinse with cold water and discard brine.
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Rub yellow mustard on the bone side of the ribs then sprinkle Jeff's original rub generously onto the ribs to cover. Flip the ribs over and repeat the mustard and rub on the meaty side. Lay aside while you set up the smoker.
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Prepare the smoker for cooking at 225-240°F with indirect heat. If your smoker uses a water pan, fill it up.
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Stage 1: Place the ribs directly on the grate and let them smoke cook for 2 hours using apple wood for smoke.
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Stage 2: Remove the ribs from the smoker and wrap with 18-inch wide heavy duty foil. Place them back into the smoker and cook for 2 hours wrapped. No smoke required during this stage.
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Stage 3: Remove the ribs from the foil and place them back into the smoker, directly on the grates. Smoke cook for 1 hour using apple wood for smoke.
f3410d1b-30ad-4311-82b9-bf88732ce128
Remove ribs from the smoker when they reach 195 degrees or when they have reached the level of tenderness that you desire. Let the ribs rest for about 10-15 minutes before slicing.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
Place the ground beef, sausage, bread crumbs, jalapeños, onions, buttermilk, eggs and Jeffs' original rub into a large bowl and combine.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
Remove the meatloaf mixture and form it into a loaf that is rectangular in shape and about 2 to 3 inches thick on top of a wood plank.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
This can be made in advance if you wish and put into the fridge until you are ready to smoke it.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
Set up your smoker for cooking at 225-240°F with indirect heat. If your smoker has a water pan, fill it up.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
Place the plank with the meatloaf on the smoker grate and cook with smoke until the internal temperature of the meatloaf reads 160°F as measured by a digital probe meat thermometer.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
About 30 minutes before the meatloaf is finished cooking, add a layer of Jeff's original barbecue sauce to the top and sides of the meatloaf.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
When the meatloaf is finished cooking, remove it from the smoker.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
Let it rest for about 10 minutes before serving.
65a05aff-1170-405d-883c-54afd724678d
Slice into ½ inch pieces and enjoy!
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: 1/2 gallon water
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: 1/2 cup kosher salt
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: 1/2 cup dark brown sugar
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: 3 TBS Louisiana hot sauce
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Add all of the ingredients to the water and stir until everything is dissolved and mixed in well.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Using gallon sized zip top bags, put 12 thighs in each bag and pour enough brine into the bag to cover. I used about ½ of the brine in each bag and it was plenty.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Seal the bags pressing out all of the air and let them sit in the fridge during the brining process. I recommend sitting the bags down in bowls to prevent the risk of leakage.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: After 3 hours, remove the bags from the fridge and discard the brine liquid.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Place 12 chicken thighs into each bowl and coat well with yellow mustard.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Pour ¼ cup of Jeff's original rub into each bowl and stir well to coat chicken.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: The chicken can now be placed onto Bradley racks, Weber grill pans or cooling racks for east transport to and from the smoker.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Setup smoker for cooking at 225-240°F with indirect heat using mesquite, pecan or whatever wood you have available for smoke.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: If your smoker has a water pan, fill it up.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Cook the chicken until it reaches 175°F as measured by a digital meat thermometer such as a thermapen or a ThermoPop.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: When the chicken is finished cooking, de-bone it (unless it's boneless), then pull the meat into pieces.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Coat the meat with an ample amount of Jeff's barbecue sauce.
e1584b57-efab-4232-b1ba-4b54f38d9869 Make the brine using: Make sandwiches with the pulled chicken topping it with coleslaw, pickles and onions.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Place chicken breast in ziploc back or between 2 pieces of wax paper.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Pound lightly with a meat mallet until desired thickness is acquired.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Apply light coat of my original rub to both sides of chicken breast.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Lay ham then swiss cheese onto top of chicken breast.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Roll up chicken breast, ham and cheese like a pinwheel.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Lay down 2 pieces of bacon parallel and about 1 inch apart
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Place rolled, stuffed chicken breast across bacon about 3 inches from end.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Pull short ends of bacon up over the chicken breast.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Roll stuffed chicken breast across bacon until about 4 inches from end.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Pull bacon pieces up over the center of stuffed chicken breast.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Overlap ends of bacon and apply a little more rub to outside.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Push toothpick through bacon and chicken to secure.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Smoke chicken cordon bleu at 240°F for 2.5 to 3 hours or until it reaches 165°F.
eff5eaa6-1085-4917-bce7-e80db80a4401
Serve immediately.
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
Remove wings from package and place in large ziploc
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
Pour oil onto wings and roll to coat
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
Spoon rub over chicken in bag
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
Roll and toss to coat well
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
Dump wings into large foil pan
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
Prepare smoker for cooking at 250-275°F
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
Place wings on smoker grate with space between them
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
Smoke for about 1.5 hours
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
About 30 minutes before finished, brush with sauce
d6587512-bcd8-4e6f-b295-db6508cec783
The wings are done when they reach 175-180°F
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Make 1/3 lb ball of 80/20 ground chuck
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Hollow out a hole or area for cheese
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Place cheese in hole
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Pull meat up and over hole to cover and seal
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Place 3-4 pieces of bacon on flat surface in criss-cross fashion
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Place stuffed burger in center of bacon
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Wrap bacon pieces around burger and secure with toothpick
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Dust generously with my original rub (purchase recipe here)
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Smoke cook until burgers reach 160°F in center
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Brush with my original barbecue sauce (purchase recipe here) 10 minutes before they are done
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Remove from heat immediately and serve
c834ab04-328f-4950-bda5-b0a089c46df3
Provide buns, veggies and condiments for the best burgers in town!
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Clean and deseed jalapeños
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Blanch jalapeños
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Make cream cheese filling
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Fill jalapeños with cream cheese filling
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Make meatloaf mixture and stuff into muffin sections on top of jalapeños
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Place pan of meat loafs into fridge to firm up for about 30 minutes
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Drop meat loafs onto cookie sheet or Bradley rack
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Place into smoker
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Fry or Bake bacon for making "crumbles"
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Top meat loafs with Jeff's barbecue sauce and bacon crumbles about 30 minutes before done
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Smoke for 3 hours or until they reach 160 degrees internal temperature
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Serve with side of grilled peppers and onions
488a1eac-cf15-49bc-bd08-c2e41cf058ad
Enjoy!
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Start by prepping your vegetables and doing any slicing, cleaning, chopping ,etc..
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Make a bacon weave on a piece of wax or parchment paper that is 7 slices by 6 slices. Weave them so they interlock and it forms a blanket of bacon.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Sprinkle some rub on the top of the bacon weave and set aside.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Place 1 lb of bacon into a gallon-size zip top bag and press it out flat. Snip off a small piece of the corner of the bag to avoid air bubbles.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Use a sharp knife or scissors to cut and remove the top side of the zip top bag.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Flip the flattened sausage over onto a piece of wax or parchment paper.. you can also just leave it on the plastic if you prefer.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Add the stuffing by layering on spinach, cheese, onions, peppers, egg slices, etc.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Use the plastic or was paper under the flattened sausage to help you roll it up. Do not roll up the plastic, continually pull it away as the sausage rolls.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Move the stuffed, rolled up sausage onto the edge of the longest side of the bacon weave.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Use the wax or parchment paper to help you roll the weave over the sausage roll making sure to continually pull the paper away as the weave is rolled up.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Set up your smoker for cooking at 225-240°F with indirect heat. I prefer to leave the water pan dry for these to encourage the bacon to crisp up better.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Smoke cook for 2.5 to 3 hours or until the internal temperature reaches 160°F.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Let them rest for about 10 minutes then slice about ½ to ¾ inch thick using a sharp knife.
7ababb9e-442c-4783-9dd0-8b99a98028ab
Great on sliders or as a side for fried eggs at breakfast!
